synopsis.p: Searches for entries in a dictionary generated by an expression.

description.p: searches on for entries generated by the expressions and . evaluates as a list of elements, the result represent the entries of the dictionary. For each entry, evaluates as a string with the entry as the context element, thus generating the entry key. When finds a match, then it sets all the features specified in : the value of the feature is the expression evaluated with the matched entry as the context element.

param-doc.name: features
param-doc.p: Feature mapping for matches. The value of the feature is the evaluation of the expression as a string with the match entry as the context element.

param-doc.name: key
param-doc.p: Expression evaluated as a string with the entry as the context element. The result is the key of the entry.

param-doc.name: active
param-doc.p: Expression evaluated as a boolean with the corpus as context element. If the result is false, then the module does not process the module.

param-doc.name: multipleValueAction
param-doc.p: Either to stop when multiple entries with the same key is seen.

param-doc.name: constantAnnotationFeatures
param-doc.p: Constant features to add to each annotation created by this module

param-doc.name: subject
param-doc.p: Subject on which to project the dictionary.

param-doc.name: documentFilter
param-doc.p: Only process document that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: errorDuplicateValues
param-doc.p: Either to stop when a duplicate entry is seen.

param-doc.name: sectionFilter
param-doc.p: Process only sections that satisfy this filter.

param-doc.name: values
param-doc.p: Expression evaluated as a list of elements with the corpus as context. Each element specifies an entry of the dictionary.

param-doc.name: targetLayerName
param-doc.p: Name of the layer where to put match annotations.

param-doc.name: userFunctions
param-doc.p: Set user functions available for this module. If this module is a sequence, then all compounds inherit its functions.
